alert.note: Alert for Pike (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 08 at 6:33PM EDT until September 08 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Pike County in northeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 930 PM EDT. * At 633 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1.5 to 2.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Matamoras, Bushkill, Milford, Dingmans Ferry, Pecks Pond, Greeley, Millrift, Lords Valley and Tamiment. The Shohola Creek watershed has received the most rainfall with up to 4 inches reported. More heavy rain is expected in this watershed. Serious flooding is possible on the Shohola Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1.5-2.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
